dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’ll drop mama a postcard from  somewhere.  I mean, I donВ’t want her to worry no moreВ’n necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean by necessary?  SheВ’s probВ’ly already called the cops, my parole officer, her p.i. boyfriend Johnnie Farragut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose so.  She knew I was bound  to see you soon as you was sprung, but I donВ’t figure she counted on us takinВ’ off together like this... I guess this means youВ’re breakinВ’ parole, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guess?  My parole was broke two hundred miles back when we burnt Portagee County.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’ll it be like in California, Sailor, do you think?  I hear it donВ’t rain much there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got about six more big states to go before we find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got through two states already. Lula lights up a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That donВ’t smell like a More.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ainВ’t.  ItВ’s part of the lessons of life.  I picked me up a pack of Vantages before we left the Cape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sure do stink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess, but - and hereВ’s the lesson part - they ainВ’t supposed to be so bad for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ainВ’t gonna begin worryinВ’ about whatВ’s bad for you at this hour, are you, sugar?  I mean, here you are crossinВ’ state lines with a A- Number One certified murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manslaughterer, honey, not murderer. DonВ’t exaggerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, manslaughterer whoВ’s broke his parole and got in mind nothinВ’ but immoral purposes farВ’s youВ’re  concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank the Lord.  Well, you ainВ’t let me down yet, Sailor.  ThatВ’s moreВ’n I can say for the rest of the world? Sailor laughs and shoots the T-Bird up to seventy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You please me, too, peanut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65. INT. JOHNNIE FARRAGUTВ’S В’69 MAROON BUICK - DAY Johnnie Farragut drives down a Southern highway on his mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is a bitch and then you marry one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda trash talk is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it says on the bumper sticker  up front.  On that pickup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThatВ’s disgustinВ’.  Those kinda sentiments shouldnВ’t be allowed out in public.  Is this Biloxi yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.  I figure we should find us a place to stay and then go eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got anyplace special in mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We oughta stay somewhere outta the way.  Not in no Holidays or Ramadas or Motel Six.  If Johnnie FarragutВ’s on our trail heВ’ll check those first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass the Biloxi City Limit sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about that one?  The Host of  the Old South Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks more like the Ghost of the  Old South, but weВ’ll try her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is large but cheap.  Lula strips off the dishwat bedspread and tosses it over by the bureau.  Sailor looks window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I H-A-T-E hotel bedspreads.  They donВ’t hardly never get washed, and I donВ’t like the idea of lyinВ’ on other peopleВ’s dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s that, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about death)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There ainВ’t no water in the swimminВ’ pool.  Just a dead tree fell in,  probВ’ly from beinВ’ struck by lightninВ’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about granddad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s huge.  This musta been a grand old place at one time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LetВ’s get fed, sweetheart.  The lightВ’s fadinВ’ fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcello Santos is making a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello there, Mr. Reindeer...   Marcello Santos speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69. INT. MR. REINDEERВ’S POSH NEW ORLEANS RESIDENCE - NIG An old man, MR. REINDEER, wearing a tuxedo is sitting on his pants down - talking on the bathroom phone.  He laugh smokerВ’s laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Marcello Santos...  Hey there... That was great shit you sent in last month...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta problem...  In fact, I gotta couplВ’a problems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69A. INT. MR. REINDEERВ’S POSH NEW ORLEANS RESIDENCE - NI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta couplВ’a problems, huh?...  For each problem drop a silver dollar through my mail slot...  With all particulars...  WeВ’ll work out  В“il contoВ” later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70. INT. JOHNNIE FARRAGUTВ’S MAROON В’69 BUICK - NIGHT Johnnie Farragut steers the Buick down the dark highway p which reads, В“NEW ORLEANS - 26 MILESВ”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor and Lula are walking along the beach.  Lula takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sing-song spells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M-i-ss-i-ss-i-pp-i...  You can almost hear that jazz blowinВ’ up from the big N.O.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lula...  I learned somethinВ’ interestinВ’ today on a science show I heard on the radio...  How leeches is cominВ’ back into style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?  Honestly, sugar, you can talk more shit sometimes? She takes out a cigarette the length and width of a Dixon No. 2 pencil and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you a pack of Mores again, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, itВ’s a real problem for me,  Sailor, you know?  When I went in that drugstore by the restaurant in Biloxi?  I saw В’em by the register and the girl throw В’em in.  IВ’m not big on resistinВ’.  So what about a leech?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard on the radio how doctors is usinВ’ leeches again, just in old times.  You know, when even barbers used В’em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shuddering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one on me at Lake Lanier.   Lifeguard poured salt on it and it dropped off.  Felt awful.  He was a cute boy, though, so it was almost worth it. Sailor laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well listen to this...  Radio said back in the 1920s a I-talian  doctor figured out that if, say, a fella got his nose cut off or bit off in, say, a barfight or somethinВ’, theyВ’d sew one of his forearms to his nose for a few weeks...  Then put leeches on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71A. CU of MAN with forearm sewed to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor?  You expect me to believe  a manВ’d be goinВ’ around with a  arm sewed to his nose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How they used to do it.  Course they got more sophisticated ways now. Radio said the Chinese, I think it is, figured a better idea is by insertinВ’ a balloon in the forehead and lettinВ’ it hand down on the nose. Lula shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor Ripley!  You stop!  YouВ’re makinВ’ this shit up and I ainВ’t gonna sit for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honest, Lula.  I probВ’ly ainВ’t precisely got all the facts straight, but itВ’s about what they said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, weВ’re goinВ’ to bed now and itВ’s time to change the subject. SheВ’s so cute Sailor just has to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor and Lula pass a sign that reads В“NEW ORLEANS - 26 pulls off the road into a Gulf gas station mini-mart and next to a self-serve pump.  A sign on the top of it says INSIDE BEFORE FUELING.В”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WeВ’re about dry bones, sweetheart. We donВ’t wanna have to push this В“birdВ” into New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure donВ’t, honey... (shouting to Sailor as he goes into the store)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a Mounds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall OLD BLACK MAN about seventy years old, wearing a t Tulane tee-shirt and a dirty orange Saints baseball cap, on the counter by the cash register.  In the pile are fou plastic-wrapped sandwiches, two tuna salad and two cotto Twinkies; a package of Chips Ahoy chocolate chip cookies; colas; two BarqВ’s root beers; and a large package of fri extra salted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sailor and another guy  also waiting to pay for gas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, gentlemen.  IВ’m В’most finished on my shoppinВ’ here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This be it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YВ’all take American Express?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then lemme throw in a couple more things. Sailor and the man in line behind him watch as the black several more packages of Twinkies along with a few cupcak dozen cans of Pretty Kitty cat food, three liver and thre dinner portions, and tosses them on his pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sailor, smiling - showing  no visible upper teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pussycats gotta eat, too. He hands an American Express card to the clerk, ERV, who the verifier.  The card checks out okay and the old guy p charge slip, has the man sign it, and bags the purchases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Erv)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’d just soon have a paper bag  rather than a plastic one, if itВ’s same to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoving the plastic bag he filled towards the black man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We donВ’t have no paper bags. A telephone begins to ring and everyone looks around.  Th reaches in his jacket pocket and pulls out a portable pho В“send.В”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...  Yeah, mama, IВ’m on my  way... (to Sailor and other guy as he picks up his bag and heads out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for waitinВ’, gentlemen. Everyone is silent as they watch the old Black Man hobble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Erv)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I wantВ’s ten bucks regular. Oh yeah, and a Mounds bar. Erv takes one off the candy and gum rack next to the regi it on the counter.  Sailor gives him a twenty dollar bill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ainВ’t got my American Express card with me, so I gotta use cash.  Hope thatВ’s okay. Sailor smiles, but the clerk keeps a poker face and just change.  The guy in line behind Sailor shakes his head an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor goes back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That took long enough.  You forget my Mounds? Sailor tosses her the candy bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really do think the country done changed just a little while I was away, peanut. Lula sinks her small white teeth into the chocolate-cover

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she chews)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to keep an eye on it.  ThatВ’s sure. Sailor starts pumping gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76. INT. MR. REINDEERВ’S POSH NEW ORLEANS RESIDENCE - DAY CU of mail slot.  Two silver dollars comes through it and up and the other tails on the rug below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77. INT. MR. REINDEERВ’S POSH NEW ORLEANS RESIDENCE - DAY Mr. Reindeer is just finishing dialing a number on the te

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couplВ’a silver dollars came my way today...  IВ’m sending one of them to you with a paper on the beneficiary ...  As usual, you are completely free to fulfill the obligation in any manner you so desire. He hangs up the phone and starts dialing another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a table near the window, Johnnie takes a man-sized pul beer in between bites of an oyster sandwich.  A large, ch man in his early thirties, REGINALD SAN PEDRO SULA, and a man, DROP SHADOW approach with their trays of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if we share this table? ...  The others, they are occupied. Johnnie looks around - sees that there are quite a few em looks the men over quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautiously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright...  By all means.  Make  yourselves at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he sits down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muchas gracias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Reginald San Pedro Sula. But please do call me Reggie.  This is my friend, who we call Drop Shadow.  He is always with me. Johnnie wipes off his right hand on his napkin and shakes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie Farragut.  Pleased to meet ya. Reggie and Drop Shadow begin eating ferociously, finishin meal before saying anything more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are from New Orleans, Senor  Farragut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie, please.  Nope.  Charlotte, North Carolina.  Here on business. Reggie smiles broadly, revealing numerous tall, gold teet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. San Pedro Sula is from Honduras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know Honduras, Johnny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only that itВ’s supposed to be a  pretty poor sight since the hurricane came through last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thatВ’s so.  But there is not  much to destroy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No big buildings like in New Orleans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattaya do there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, many things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. San Pedro SulaВ’s got an appliance shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am also with the government. Johnnie takes a bite of his oyster sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In what capacity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In many capacities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. San Pedro Sula is with the  Secret Service. Reggie reaches into his back pocket and takes out his wal a card to Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading aloud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Osvaldo Tamarindo y Ramirez. Telefono 666.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is my sponsor.  The General is the head of the secret police of Honduras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. San Pedro Sula is one of his operatives. Johnnie hands the card back to Reggie and Reggie gives hi of paper, folded once.  Johnnie unfolds it.  The printing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is my permiso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. San Pedro SulaВ’s permit to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if necessary, of course, and only in my own country. (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Johnnie refolds the piece of paper and hands it over to R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. San Pedro SulaВ’s authorized to carry a .45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United States Marine issue, before they made the unfortunate switch to the less dependable nine millimeters. I have it here, in my briefcase. Reggie holds up his stainless steel briefcase and then re the floor beneath his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you in New Orleans?  If you  donВ’t mind my askinВ’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly not.  We are here only briefly, in fact, until this evening, when we fly to Austin, Texas to visit a friend of mine who is an agent for the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to take Mr. San Pedro Sula and me bass fishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in the same businesses and also we are fishermen. Johnnie swallows the last of his beer and stands up to le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s been a real pleasure.  I wish you both buena suerte wherever you go. Reggie and Drop Shadow stand up.  They shake JohnnieВ’s h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same to you.  If you are in  Honduras, come to the Bay Islands and visit us.  The Hondurans are great friends of the American people.  But I have a joke for you before I go. If a liberal, a socialist, and a  communist all jumped off the roof of the Empire State Building at the  same time, which one of them would hit the ground first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldnВ’t say, which one? Reggie turns to Drop Shadow and lets him have the punch l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor and Lula are just finishing making love in their r climaxes, her left hand opens and spreads wide.  The lay moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it when your eyes get wild, honey.  They light up all blue almost and little white parachutes pop out of В’em.  Oh, Sailor youВ’re so aware of what goes on with me?  I mean, you pay attention.  And I swear, you got  the sweetest cock.  Sometimes itВ’s like itВ’s talkinВ’ to me when youВ’re inside?  Like itВ’s got a voice all itВ’s own.  You get right on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are dangerously cute,  honey.  I gotta admit it. Lula lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LetВ’s head out into the crazy world of New Orleans...  I gotta get  somethinВ’ to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80. INT. RONNIEВ’S NOTHINВ’ FANCY CAFE - NEW ORLEANS - LA Sailor and Lula sit at the counter drinking double-sized community coffee.  A MAN on the stool next to Sailor ligh soaked crook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My nameВ’s George Kovich.  Bet youВ’ve heard of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t know that I have...  Should I  know about you for anythinВ’ in  particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was in all the papers three years ago. IВ’m seventy-six, was only seventy- three then.  Had a business in Buffalo, New York, called Rats With Wings.  Killed pigeons for anyone who wanted В’em killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you killinВ’ pigeons, Mr. Kovich?  Were you in the extermination business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, maВ’am.  I was a housepainter,  in the union forty-one years.  IВ’m retired now, livinВ’ with my sister,  Ida.  Ida moved down here twenty-five years ago, married an oil man named Smoltz, Ed Smoltz.  HeВ’s dead now, so itВ’s just me and Ida.  I sold my house and moved down after the city of Buffalo put me out of business. Hell, RWW was doinВ’ them a service, and they charged me with endangerinВ’ the public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s wrong with pigeons, Mr. Kovich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TheyВ’re useless pests.  IВ’ve shot hundreds of В’em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81. EXT. CITY STREET - ROOFTOP IN GEORGE KOVICHВ’S NEIGHB George is shooting pigeons as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice-over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...My neighbors hired me to get rid of the pigeons that gathered on their roofs and porches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82. INT. RONNIEВ’S NOTHINВ’ FANCY CAFE - NEW ORLEANS - LA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Neighbors asked me how come the spotted bastards didnВ’t light on my house or my brother EarlВ’s anymore, and I told В’em the truth.  I shot В’em...  EarlВ’s gone now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83. INT. EARL KOVICHВ’S HOUSE - DAY Earl pitches forward out of his easy chair and hits the c screaming in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice-over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Heart attack six months ago - had that cholesterol thick as shit... His widow, Mildred, she still lives in the house next to mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84. INT. RONNIEВ’S NOTHINВ’ FANCY CAFE - NEW ORLEANS - LA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SheВ’s stone deaf but the racket the pigeons made drove Earl crazy.  He could hear В’em even with the TV on. He owned a bar thirty years, The Boilermaker, on Wyoming Street.   EarlВ’s roof was a favorite spot for pigeons.  They lit there day and night. I wanted to toss a grenade up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your neighbors didnВ’t mind,  howВ’d you get put out of business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman drivinВ’ down the street spotted me with on a roof with my rifle.  She called the police and they came over and arrested me.  Thought I was a sniper!  Boys at the VFW loved that one.  Cops didnВ’t understand about the pigeons, the damage they do to personal property.  I used to complain to the city but they never lifted a finger.  I was gonna put out poison, but I was afraid somebodyВ’s cat  would eat it.  Hell, I had six cats myself.  So I used the .22 because it didnВ’t make much noise and the ammo was cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened on the charges?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty on a reduced charge.  Hundred dollar fine and ordered to desist. Pigeons carry diseases and muss up the place.  You seen it.  Plain filth. Kovich stands up and puts some money on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s a serious situation.  Not like the Turks and the Armenians, maybe, or the Arabs and the Jews, but I want people to remember me and what IВ’ve done and pick up where I left off.  Somebody had to make a move. It was nice meetinВ’ you folks. George Kovich nods and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What lesson do get outta that story, Lula?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s just another case, Sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s that, peanut?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One person thinks heВ’s doinВ’ somethinВ’ good and everВ’body else gets upset about it. Sailor looks up at Lula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AinВ’t it the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s very quiet in the hotel room and the clock says fou Sailor are lying in bed arm in arm.  Sailor is fast aslee Lula is wide awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor?...  Sailor, honey? Sailor snaps awake with a snort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever imagine what itВ’d be like to get eaten alive by a wild beast?... Sometimes I think it would be the biggest thrill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it better be, darlinВ’, cause itВ’d be the last...  What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh...  ItВ’s four oВ’clock...  That womanВ’s laugh the other day had somethinВ’ to do with this feelinВ’? ...  Like beinВ’ ripped apart by a gorilla, maybe...  Grabbed sudden  and pulled apart real quick by a  real powerful one. LulaВ’s left hand opens and spreads wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lula, sometimes I gotta admit, you come up with some weird thoughts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AnythinВ’ interestinВ’ in the world come out of somebodyВ’s weird thoughts, Sailor.  You tell me Sailor, who could come up with shit like weВ’re seeinВ’ these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me, peanut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles - turns to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ainВ’t never met anyone come close to you, sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recall the time we was sittinВ’ one night behind the Confederate soldier? LeaninВ’ against it.  And you took your hand and put it on your heart and you said, В‘You feel it beatinВ’  in there, Lula?...  Get used to it, cause it belongs to you now.В’  DВ’you recall that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.text: Dear Lula, It is fine with me about the baby as you already know.  And Pace being your family name and all is just right. What about a middle name if it is a boy after my  granddaddy Roscoe?  He would be proud I know though he is long passed.  Pace Roscoe Ripley does not sound so bad do you think? This place is not so pretty as Pee Dee.  Not pretty at all.  There are boys inside these walls meaner than Peru you can bet.  There is a Death House.  I am getting along.  The only thing is not thinking about the future. I miss dancing with you, too.  I love you.  It is hard to end this letter.  If I stop writing youВ’re gone.  There is not a lot more to say though. Vava con dios mi amor. Sailor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152. INT. MARIETTA FORTUNEВ’S HOUSE - EVENING/ 153. INT. LULA FORTUNEВ’S HOUSE - EVENING - (SIX YEARS LA Six years later...  Lula stands in the living room holdin ice water while talking on the telephone to her mother. wearing a giant diamond ring on one hand and the other ha Martini and Rossi sweet vermouth.  Marietta is slumped ov ottoman with wheels and is pushing her drunken self aroun livingroom as she talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m goinВ’, mama.  No way I canВ’t go.

dialogues.text: Course I am, mama.

dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What timeВ’s SailorВ’s train get in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.text: Got any plans?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure weВ’ll go have supper someplace. Maybe get some barbecue out by  Stateline.  Sailor always liked that Havana BrownВ’s Pig PickinВ’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you be careful with that boy, Lula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor ainВ’t a boy no more, mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t mean him.  ItВ’s Pace concerns me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, mama, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I asked you not to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WouldnВ’t make any difference.

dialogues.text: What if I told you not to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcefully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama ... if you get in the way of me and SailorВ’s happiness, IВ’ll fuckinВ’ pull your arms out by the roots. Lula hangs up and throws her glass of water at a picture draining it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 154. INT. LULAВ’S CAR - EVENING PACE ROSCOE FORTUNE is a shy, polite, innocent six-year o long-billed fishing cap and pants with suspenders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HowВ’ll we know what he looks like? Lula makes a wide left turn onto Jeff Davis Highway witho causing the driver of a white Bonneville headed across th to jam on his brakes in order to avoid a collision.  The driver sits on his horn and shouts at Lula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama, you almost crashed us. Lula steadies the steering wheel of her Camaro with her l she strikes a match and lights up a More.  She throws the window and takes possession of the wheel with both hands, is clamped in her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t give me no trouble now, Pace, please.  This ainВ’t the easiest day in a long time.  And what do you mean how are we gonna know what your daddy looks like?  You seen his photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HowВ’ll he know what we look like? He seen our photo? Lula puffs furiously several times on her More before she of her mouth and drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, child!  Now look what you made me do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I made you do, mama? Lula feels around on the floor with one hand until she fi cigarette.  Sirens can be heard up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NothinВ’, honey.  (stubbing it out in the ashtray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MamaВ’s just actinВ’ strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ainВ’t actinВ’, mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Pace Roscoe Ripley, ainВ’t you got one cute mouth tonight? They pass an automobile accident where a man has been thr curb - his head broken open and bleeding.  The ambulance arriving.  Lula looks away.

dialogues.speaker: ACCIDENT
dialogues.text: A CRAZY MAN in a wheelchair is wheel up to the accident v bleeding profusely and in a state of shock.  The man in t stares at him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man...  HEY...  Same fuckinВ’ thing happened to me last year...

dialogues.text: 156. INT. LULAВ’S CAR - EVENING Pace looks up at his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still ainВ’t sure what my daddy  looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you, sweetheart.  You and your daddy got the same mouth, eyes, ears, and nose.  Only difference is your color hair is like mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy ainВ’t never killed nobody, has he, mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course he ainВ’t never killed nobody. WhyВ’d you say that, Pace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard grandpa Santos and grandmama talkinВ’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandmama said how Sailor murdered a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong, baby.  Your daddy never  committed no murder.  Musta been you  didnВ’t hear grandmama proper.  He made  some mistakes, is all.  Your daddy ainВ’t  always been so lucky...  WeВ’re almost at the depot, honey.  Sit back a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lula pulls the Camaro into in the station parking lot and engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why we sittinВ’ here, mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ThinkinВ’ a second, baby. Lula gets out and goes around for Pace.  They hold hands toward the station.  The big clock on the side of the bui minutes past six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m scared, mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Case daddy donВ’t like me.  What if he donВ’t like that I donВ’t got  his color hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pace, your daddyВ’d love you even if you didnВ’t have no hair at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lula sees Sailor as soon as she opens the door.  He is si orange plastic chair against the opposite wall, smoking a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still partial to Camels, huh? Sailor smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First pack of tailor-mades I had in a while. He stands up and looks down at Pace, who is still holding Lula.  Sailor puts out his right hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake hands with your daddy. Pace releases LulaВ’s hand and puts his own in SailorВ’s. gently but firmly, pumps once, then lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you, Pace.  I read a lot about you. Sailor looks at Lula.  Her eyes are full of tears and she loose.  Sailor tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?  Pace and I ainВ’t had dinner yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lead the way. Sailor picks up his black metal suitcase and follows them

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 159. INT. LULAВ’S CAR - NIGHT Lula drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No rag top, huh? Lula starts to reply, then stops.  She stares straight ah the wheel hard.  Suddenly, she pulls over to the side of off the engine and gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’s wrong, mama?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Pace and  patting his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t worry, son.  Just stay here. Sailor gets out and goes over to Lula, who is leaning bac hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IВ’m sorry, Sailor.  I just canВ’t  help it.  Give me a minute and IВ’ll quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys frightened, Lula.  This ainВ’t no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Sail, IВ’ll be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ItВ’s a mistake, honey.  You two go on. IВ’ll walk back to the depot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WhatВ’re you talkinВ’ about?  ThatВ’s  your son in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ainВ’t never known me, Lula, so  there ainВ’t much for him to forget. Not seeinВ’ each other for six years makes it next best to simple for us, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you say that, Sailor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes sense, is all. Sailor goes around to the driverВ’s side, reaches in and out of the ignition.  He unlocks the trunk, removes his s closes the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DonВ’t do this, Sailor, please. Sailor slips the keys in her shirt pocket and leans his h car.

dialogues.text: (to Pace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oiga, amigo.  If ever somethinВ’  donВ’t feel right to you, remember what Pancho said to The Cisco Kid...   В‘LetВ’s went, before we are dancing at the end of a rope, without music.В’ Sailor stands up and looks at Lula.  Her eye makeup runs down her face. ECU of LulaВ’s eyes.  Her eye makeup runs like black swea down her cheeks as in SailorВ’s dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been doinВ’ fine without me, peanut.  There ainВ’t no need to make life  tougherВ’n it has to be. He picks up his suitcase, kisses Lula lightly on the lips away.  She lets him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor walks down the street pretending hard not to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161. INT. LULAВ’S CAR - LATE AFTERNOON/EVENING Lula climbs in behind the wheel - sobbing.  Pace sits sad the window.

dialogues.text: Sailor continues walking down the street.  A GANG OF INSA TEENAGERS on PCP appear and come towards Sailor.  They ci him, coming in closer for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you faggots want? ThatВ’s all it takes.  The gang is on him.  Sailor tries himself, but one big punch to his nose sends him down and begins to pour from his swelling nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU OF SAILORВ’S FACE - a bright light illuminates it. In the sky above Sailor, a large glowing bubble holding t Good Witch of the North comes floating down above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor Ripley... SailorВ’s eyes suddenly see the Good Witch through his cl His mouth speaks through closed lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Witch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor...  Lula loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But IВ’m a robber and a manslaughterer and I havenВ’t had any parental  guidance.

dialogues.text: SheВ’s forgiven you of all these things ...  You love her...  DonВ’t be afraid, Sailor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But IВ’m wild at heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are truly wild at heart, youВ’ll fight for your dreams...  DonВ’t turn away from love, Sailor...  DonВ’t turn away from love...  DonВ’t turn away from love. The Good Witch disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sailor opens his eyes and drags himself and his giant swo his feet.  The gang still stands around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had enough, asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have...  And I wanna apologize to you gentlemen for referring to  you as homosexuals.  I also want to thank you fellas, youВ’ve taught me a valuable lesson in life.   (lifts his head high)

dialogues.text: Sailor turns around and starts running back.  The gang wa

dialogues.text: Lula wriggles out of the car and flys into his arms.  Beh giant golden sunset.  As they embrace - the sound of the away.  LulaВ’s gaze goes to a reflection of golden light It is the same abstract scene she saw before in her room but now she knows what it is.  It is PaceВ’s happy, smili up at the two of them in love. Sailor, with a giant blue nose, looks into LulaВ’s eyes a Me Tender.В”  The people in their cars, and the people on the street lo feeling of love and happiness in their hearts.
